channel.title: Notes on STAT400: Statistical Computing
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on STAT400: Statistical Computing

item.title: Chapter 0: Some Useful Tools
item.description:
We will start the class with some tools that will be useful for success in this class. Going forward, we will use these tools for any computing and data analysis tasks.
Adapted from R for Data Science, Wickham & Grolemund (2017)
In STAT400, we will cover each part of the data analysis pipeline using R R (https://www.r-project.org) is a free, open source software environment for statistical computing and graphics that is available for every major platform.

item.title: STAT400: Statistical Computing
item.description: Dr.Â Andee Kaplan 208 Statistics Building Office Hours: TR 11:00am - 12:00pm in Statistics 208 Lectures: TR 9:30am - 10:45am in Military Sciences 115 andee.kaplan@colostate.edu Course Objectives Computationally intensive statistical methods are a key component to modern data analysis methods. After completing this course, a successful student will be able to use statistical software to implement both traditional and state-of-the-art methods in computational statistics as well as recognize situations where these methods are required.
